intro: Gentianella angustiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gentian, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
